author: timbeiko
content:
Thanks for the context! 

Re: (1), I'd _like_ to see it (and could perhaps see the EF providing a small grant if someone was really keen to do this but lacked funding?), but historically it's been hard to find people who want to do this work üòÖ  Spec work is pretty thankless, and so we sort of end up going with whoever shows up. 

Re: (2), it's not really "the EF" who'd make this call, but I suspect more "AllCoreDevs" (i.e. the set of all client teams + folks involved with protocol work). That would be my preferred option (see: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/core-eips-in-an-executable-spec-world/8640) but I don't think we quite have the consensus to move forward here (and EELS still needs a bit of polish AIUI). That said, I'm happy to bring this up on calls once the python spec is finalized and we feel like it's the right time to move forward.
